summary: This document is an email chain from October 21, 2020, discussing the drafting of an invitation and RSVP language for a victim and family briefing scheduled for November 12, 2020, at the FBI's Miami Field Office. The briefing, to be conducted by the DOJ, concerns the Office of Professional Responsibility's (OPR) findings on the Epstein investigation. The FBI's Victim Services Division (VSD) is consulting and supporting the event, and the information will be presented to Congress shortly after the briefing to prevent leaks.

persons.name: Paul
persons.context: Mentioned as someone whose travel expenses to the briefing the VSD Program Manager will inquire about.

persons.name: Regina
persons.context: A colleague who was wondering about the exact date the OPR findings would be presented to Congress following the victim briefing.

persons.name: Program Manager FBI Victim Services Division
persons.role: FBI Victim Services Division Program Manager
persons.context: The primary sender/forwarder of the email chain, coordinating the invitation language and logistics for the upcoming victim briefing regarding the OPR's Epstein investigation findings.

connections.person1: Program Manager FBI Victim Services Division
connections.description: The Program Manager is providing briefing language to M and asking them to inform their management.

connections.person1: Program Manager FBI Victim Services Division
connections.description: The Program Manager states they will find out if VSD can pay for Paul's travel to the briefing.

events.title: DOJ Victim and Family Briefing on OPR Findings
events.description: The Department of Justice will conduct a briefing for victims and families at the Miami Field Office regarding the Office of Professional Responsibility's findings on the Epstein investigation. The briefing will cover the process followed by federal prosecutors in the Southern District of Florida, including victim interactions.
personsInvolved: Program Manager FBI Victim Services Division

events.title: Planned Invitation Distribution
events.description: The FBI Victim Services Division plans to send out invitations for the November 12th victim briefing.
personsInvolved: Program Manager FBI Victim Services Division

keyFacts: The DOJ's Office of Professional Responsibility (OPR) completed findings on the Epstein investigation, which were to be briefed to victims and families.
A victim and family briefing was scheduled for November 12, 2020, at the FBI's Miami Field Office, with the FBI's Victim Services Division in a support role.
The information from the OPR findings was to be presented to Congress immediately after the victim briefing to prevent leaks, indicating high-level oversight.
The briefing was explicitly stated to provide no case updates, focusing solely on the process followed by prosecutors and victim interactions.
The email chain shows internal FBI/DOJ coordination and sensitivity around communicating the OPR's findings to victims and Congress.
